data.title: Pieology = great thin crust pizza
data.text: Last night we decided to try Pieology. I am on a personal hunt for great thin pizza like we ate in the Chicago area and I finally found the place, Pieology. I ordered the pick you own toppings pizza with several types of meat and veggies. The Italian sausage was top notch as were the veggie toppings. The crust was thin and crispy. No other place in the Nashville can make a pizza as good as Pieology for the price or for that matter any price. No matter what I wanted as toppings and as much of each topping as I wanted for one price - under $9.00. They also have salad and interesting bottled soft drinks or a selection of machine drinks. If you like many toppings and thin crust pizza - Pieology is the place to try.

data.title: Great place for lunch or dinner
data.text:
Stop in pick your toppings and enjoy your personal pizza! Love it!!
Only downside is slow at the register...

data.title: Food quality?
data.text: The pizza is pretty good! But, don't let your kids get the apple juice. It literally says "concentrate from China" right on the top of the bottle. I nearly let my two-year old drink this. It makes me REALLY question the quality of the rest of their ingredients. They should swap the juice out for an organic option NOT from concentrate.

data.title: Fast, Friendly, Franklin
data.text:
We went with three of our teens two weeks ago for a family lunch on a Saturday. I was fearful the line was going to be horrendous for a Saturday in our town, but it wasn't bad. The line moved quickly and we had no trouble getting a seat. Seating is limited but one can always get their pizza to go and sit on the grassy area of the circle and make a picnic out of it!

There's a great variety of "stuff" in which to top your crust with so each of our teens were thoroughly pleased. The crust is thin, which we love so if you don't, you'll be disappointed. You can choose as many or as little sauces, cheese, and toppings as you prefer--which is a hit for teen boys. Expensive if you have someone who just wants a cheese pizza, but wonderful for those who love it all. A couple of our crusts were burnt (black burnt) which was a disappointment, but we didn't complain. 

We've seen Pieology on Groupon, but apparently they aren't supposed to be on Groupon. This is a California based company, and this store currently has no coupons of any kind.

data.title: Personalized pizza on Main Street
data.text: Every time we have gone, there is a decent line. That said, it tends to move quickly. My husband and I went there and the line was literally to the door, but we only waited in line about 15 minutes, which wasn't bad. You can make the pizzas (or salads) your own-because it's all your own! One pizza is more than enough for me-I usually have some left over, and it's just right for my husband. There are tons of options to choose from, (sauce, toppings, drizzle on top, even dough!) and the crust ends up crispy, but not dry. It's a great value for about $9! Everyone always goes home happy.

data.title: Subway for pizza's - with slow employee's
data.text:
Great choice for families looking for an economical evening out, or even a solo option like me. But be warned that unlike most pizza's, it's one pizza per adult. 
Pro's and Con's
* Larger than a personal pan, but due to size, one pizza per adult.
* Very thin crust, if you like those, you'll be thrilled, otherwise no. 
* Any toppings you want, but they've VERY skimpy when first adding. For example, I asked for spinach (with many other veggie's) and they literally put on 4 spinach leaves.  She did add more when I asked, but *maybe* 8 to 10 total. The sauce is also *very* thin, it doesn't even cover the entire pizza, no matter what you pick.
* Short cooking time but HORRIBLE wait in even a short line!
* Gluten free options, but if you have a serious allergy, avoid or check as I do not think it's made on separate equipment

I've been about 2 or 3 times. I like them okay. Biggest problem-  RIDICULOUS wait time! This is just one example, but I've had some variant of this EVERY TIME I went, whether in peak time or when they were in a lull.
Example wait -  I went early Sunday afternoon - around 4 - and there was literally only one person in line ahead of me. He was getting 3 pizza's and had already finished the order on one when I arrived. I had to wait TEN MINUTES before I could even get to the counter to request my order. And then felt 'hurried' b/c they called the next person up right afterwards who were physically standing close and doing the impatient 'Hurry up' look while I ordered my toppings. Why did you not figure out how to do this when I was waiting people???

And the wait was Despite the fact there were 4 employee's in the back who were obviously Not on break but were just standing around talking with each other for what looked like simple chit chat, again -for ten minutes. Which is absolutely ridiculous for a place that is essentially a dressed up fast food restaurant. The person actually preparing the pizza seemed to be going in slow motion, and not just because I was hungry, truly, she just moved physically very slow. Again, not good for an area where you need someone who can reach and scatter ingredients quickly!

The cooking time is fairly fast, but also can cause a slightly undercooked pizza - again, this has happened every time I went. 

The topping's are reasonably good and they have a wide variety, but they don't add much as you can't and have it all cook thoroughly I would assume. Super thin crust is tasty at least. 

Suggestions to them: 
* Options for a thicker crust pizza with a longer cooking time, and a larger size.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: Now, this isn't a world class pie but for $9 for every topping available, it's darn good. The crust is super thin and crunchy. After you make your selection it takes 3-5 minutes to cook. This makes for a fast, casual, affordable meal. I suggest getting the garlic crust and mixing the pesto with the red sauce and adding fresh basil after cooking. Don't bother with the $10 salad.

data.title: Worth the wait for the best ever!
data.text:
Ok, if you go on a Saturday afternoon around lunch time there will be a wait...having said that, its very worth the wait, but I do think that the mgr needs to have his best on the register during peak times which was not the case on this day...BUT it is the  best pizza in town...Love the ability to pick and choose my toppings and see it being created!
The folks are so very nice and its very well maintained. Happy they are here in Frankin!
GO for lunch during the week...its slow paced and still terrific..

data.title: Pieology is a great value
data.text: I am not a big fan of pizza but I ate at Pieology twice in the last week.  Their food is great & their prices are so low, I do not see how they are going to stay in business,

data.title: No Pie for me!
data.text:
I ordered two medium pizzas using a 2-4-1 card. I picked it up 4 blocks away. 
Awful! I had great expectations, but this was no pizza pie at any price point. One pie was undercooked, the other was ok. Very skimpy ingredients, crust was like cardboard. The best part of this experience was on the telephone. They were very nice and informative. I wish that had been honest about how bad their pizzas were. 

I'm done. Won't be back there ever.

data.title: Great fresh Pizza on a light crust
data.text: This is a great place to grab a Pie, the place very friendly and the Pizza made to order as you instruct the help what you want on it and how you want it ! I am a big fan since we have a very flavorful crust with fresh ingredients.

data.title: If you can drive, drive - Blaze and Pie 5 better
data.text:
The crust is no good, they are chincy with amount of toppings, and the pizzas are over priced vs. the competition.  I'd rather have a real pizza - Brooklyn Bros - a couple miles away.  Blaze is in Brentwood but is much better. Pie 5 in Cool Springs better as well.

Not much flavor, the free desert for joining the e-club stunk, and they have no fresh brewed iced tea - just the nasty gold peak.

The atmosphere, workers, and people were first rate - and I do appreciate that.  Just that the pizza stinks - and isn't that why you go?

data.title: Paper Thin Pizza...Gimmicky!
data.text: Ok, you want to try the new, paper Thin pizza from Pieology in Franklin, next to Chicos, first of all, the crust is not much thicker than a large cracker, the toppings fall right off...They get you there with a 2 for 1 coupon, gimmicky in that you can order as many toppings as you want, like you at subway, without paying for each topping, the problem though, is the crust is so paper thin, that the toppings fall right off.  You have to fold it in half to hold the toppings, the taste...hmmm, no different than any other pizza with sausage and pepperoni.  If you are hungry, you will need 2 pizzas, because they are basically a personal pan, rolled out like a cracker to make 11.5  inches. They offer goat cheese, and "vegan", and "organic" to grab hold of the "hip" crowd in Franklin, ha ha.  If you are gonna try this gimmicky stuff for 2, I suggest you buy 2, put one on top of the other like a sandwich, and eat it double decker, otherwise, you will be wondering where the main course is when your done...

data.title: Underwhelming Pizza Experience
data.text: Great concept but finished product not so hot. The plus is that it's right on Main Street in Franklin. We went with another couple and ordered three pizzas and two salads.You can order a pizza from the menu or add as much stuff as you like to one you custom make. The Margherita pizza from the menu was tasteless. Way too much cheese and not enough tomato or basil. The meat pizza was a little better but not great either. The one we custom made was the best of the lot. We started with a rustic pizza and added garlic and olive oil plus an extra scoop of red sauce. We then added red onion, spinach, black olives, artichoke hearts and mushrooms. We didn't know what to make of the salad. We ordered a Caesar Salad with no croutons. We got a big bowl of chicken pieces with a few pieces of romaine. We didn't order chicken on the salad. That was a head scratcher. Also, as of Friday, August 26, craft beer and wine are not available. Other plusses were nice staff and pizza's were only $8.95 each. I think kids would love this place because they could get as creative as they like and could really go to town on a pizza creation.

data.title: Friends Lunch
data.text: We were looking or something new that we would all enjoy!  Design your own pizza was an excellent idea!!!  Pick your topping and its at your table 5 minutes or less!  The salads are prepared, fresh and excellent.  Great service and great pizza!!!  The pizza reminds me more of a California style pizza stone fired, hand crafted and we LOVED it!!!  Unlimited toppings for $8.95!
